ygData.subject: Re: Slow load and zoning
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks for the info. Microsoft says it is full compatible with DirectX 8.x, and even suggests upgrading for multi-player and online games. Maybe the EQ
ygData.messageBody:
Thanks for the info.

Microsoft says it is full compatible with DirectX 8.x, and even
suggests upgrading for multi-player and online games. Maybe the EQ
developers just haven't had a chance to test and approve it yet?

Unfortunately it cannot be uninstalled anyway according to the
Microsoft FAQ:

http://www.microsoft.com/windows/directx/productinfo/overview/faq.asp

The biggest problem we have right now is that when zoning, after
waiting 5 minutes, it crashes back to the server screen more often
than not.

Thanks again.

Regards.


--- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, Melanie Johnson <melanie_6602@y...>
wrote:
>
> I read somewhere recently that EQ does not support DirectX 9 as of
yet... this might be some of the problem. Sony is saying to stay with
DirectX 8.1 for now.
> apcooper <apc@t...> wrote:
> The only other components that could be awapped are the hard disk
> controller - but I really don't see that making much difference
since
> it is working fine, and the video controller - which is a nVidia
Riva
> TNT with just 16Mb RAM. We are running DirectX 9.
>
>
